verses.text: Concerning the divisions of the porters : Of the Korhites \add was\add* Meshelemiah the son of Kore , of the sons of Asaph.\f + \fr 26.1 \ft Meshelemiah: also called, Shelemiah\f*\f + \fr 26.1 \ft Asaph: also called, Ebiasaph\f*
And the sons of Meshelemiah \add were\add*, Zechariah the firstborn , Jediael the second , Zebadiah the third , Jathniel the fourth ,
Elam the fifth , Jehohanan the sixth , Elioenai the seventh.
Moreover the sons of Obed-edom \add were\add*, Shemaiah the firstborn , Jehozabad the second , Joah the third , and Sacar the fourth , and Nethaneel the fifth ,
Ammiel the sixth , Issachar the seventh , Peulthai the eighth : for God blessed him.\f + \fr 26.5 \ft him: that is, Obed-edom\f*
Also unto Shemaiah his son were sons born , that ruled throughout the house of their father : for they \add were\add* mighty men of valour.
The sons of Shemaiah ; Othni , and Rephael , and Obed , Elzabad , whose brethren \add were\add* strong men , Elihu , and Semachiah.
All these of the sons of Obed-edom : they and their sons and their brethren , able men for strength for the service , \add were\add* threescore and two of Obed-edom.
And Meshelemiah had sons and brethren , strong men , eighteen.
Also Hosah , of the children of Merari , had sons ; Simri the chief , (for \add though\add* he was not the firstborn , yet his father made him the chief ;)
Hilkiah the second , Tebaliah the third , Zechariah the fourth : all the sons and brethren of Hosah \add were\add* thirteen.

Among these \add were\add* the divisions of the porters , \add even\add* among the chief men , \add having\add* wards one against another , to minister in the house of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*. \p
¶ And they cast lots , as well the small as the great , according to the house of their fathers , for every gate.\f + \fr 26.13 \ft as well…: or, as well for the small as for the great\f*
And the lot eastward fell to Shelemiah. Then for Zechariah his son , a wise counsellor , they cast lots ; and his lot came out northward.\f + \fr 26.14 \ft Shelemiah: also called Meshelemiah\f*
To Obed-edom southward ; and to his sons the house of Asuppim.\f + \fr 26.15 \ft Asuppim: Heb. gatherings\f*
To Shuppim and Hosah \add the lot came forth\add* westward , with the gate Shallecheth , by the causeway of the going up , ward against ward.
Eastward \add were\add* six Levites , northward four a day , southward four a day , and toward Asuppim two \add and\add* two.
At Parbar westward , four at the causeway , \add and\add* two at Parbar.
These \add are\add* the divisions of the porters among the sons of Kore , and among the sons of Merari. \p
¶ And of the Levites , Ahijah \add was\add* over the treasures of the house of God , and over the treasures of the dedicated things.\f + \fr 26.20 \ft dedicated…: Heb. holy things\f*

\add As concerning\add* the sons of Laadan ; the sons of the Gershonite Laadan , chief fathers , \add even\add* of Laadan the Gershonite , \add were\add* Jehieli.\f + \fr 26.21 \ft Laadan: also called, Libni\f*\f + \fr 26.21 \ft Jehieli: also called, Jehiel\f*
The sons of Jehieli ; Zetham , and Joel his brother , \add which were\add* over the treasures of the house of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.
Of the Amramites , \add and\add* the Izharites , the Hebronites , \add and\add* the Uzzielites :
And Shebuel the son of Gershom , the son of Moses , \add was\add* ruler of the treasures.
And his brethren by Eliezer ; Rehabiah his son , and Jeshaiah his son , and Joram his son , and Zichri his son , and Shelomith his son.

Which Shelomith and his brethren \add were\add* over all the treasures of the dedicated things , which David the king , and the chief fathers , the captains over thousands and hundreds , and the captains of the host , had dedicated.
Out of the spoils won in battles did they dedicate to maintain the house of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.\f + \fr 26.27 \ft spoils…: Heb. battles and spoils\f*

And all that Samuel the seer , and Saul the son of Kish , and Abner the son of Ner , and Joab the son of Zeruiah , had dedicated ; \add and\add* whosoever had dedicated \add any thing, it was\add* under the hand of Shelomith , and of his brethren. \p
¶ Of the Izharites , Chenaniah and his sons \add were\add* for the outward business over Israel , for officers and judges.

\add And\add* of the Hebronites , Hashabiah and his brethren , men of valour , a thousand and seven hundred , \add were\add* officers among them of Israel on this side Jordan westward in all the business of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and in the service of the king.\f + \fr 26.30 \ft officers…: Heb. over the charge\f*

Among the Hebronites \add was\add* Jerijah the chief , \add even\add* among the Hebronites , according to the generations of his fathers. In the fortieth year of the reign of David they were sought for, and there were found among them mighty men of valour at Jazer of Gilead.

And his brethren , men of valour , \add were\add* two thousand and seven hundred chief fathers , whom king David made rulers over the Reubenites , the Gadites , and the half tribe of Manasseh , for every matter pertaining to God , and affairs of the king.\f + \fr 26.32 \ft affairs: Heb. thing\f*
